alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kenton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 4:30PM EST until March 03 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EST FOR NORTHERN KENTON...NORTHERN BOONE AND WESTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES... At 429 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Shawnee, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Erlanger, Newport, North College Hill, Cheviot, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Mount Healthy, Fort Wright, Ludlow, Crescent Springs, Park Hills, Finneytown, Burlington, Cleves, Shawnee, Taylor Creek, Bridgetown and Miami Heights. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 1. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 5 and 19. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 190 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 6. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EST for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
